subject: Design
title: The Tiny House Movement: Less Space, More Life
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Tiny House Movement: Less Space, More Life usable.

hook.text: Tiny houses average 400 square feet. Yet their owners report higher life satisfaction than McMansion dwellers.

buildup.text: The movement rejects excess square footage in favor of intentional, multi-functional spaces.

discovery.text: Designers use fold-out furniture, loft beds, and hidden storage to make small spaces feel large.

twist.text: Zoning laws in most cities make tiny houses illegal. The biggest barrier is law, not design.

climax.text: Tiny houses prove that great interior design is about intention per square foot, not total area.

punchline.text: The best-designed homes prove less space means more life.

quiz.question: What is the biggest barrier to tiny house adoption?
options: Zoning laws that make tiny houses illegal in most cities
